content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you could solve this problem in Julia. We will use regular expressions to match words starting with a capital letter.

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    names = filter(word -> !ismatch(r"^[A-Z]", word), words)
    return names
end
```
This function takes in a vector of strings `words`, iterates over each word and keeps only those starting with a capital letter. It uses the regular expression `r"^[A-Z]"` to check if a string starts with an uppercase character. The `filter` function is used here because it returns only the elements for which the condition (`ismatch(r"^[A-Z]", word) == false`) holds true.
